burlap.behavior.singleagent.learning.actorcritic

Interface Actor

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Policy
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BoltzmannActor

    public interface Actor
extends Policy
    This class provides the interface necessary for the actor portion of an Actor-Critic learning algorithm. Actors are almost entirely identical to policies since they effectively specify how the agent should act; in fact, this interface extends the Policy interface. However, the extra important functionality that an actor must incorporate is the ability to adjust its policy in response to some critique of its behavior. In this class, this functionality should be implemented in the update(EnvironmentOutcome, double) method. The interface also provides methods for telling the actor when an episode starts and ends.
    Author:
    James MacGlashan

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void endEpisode()
      This method is called whenever a learning episode terminates
      void reset()
      Used to reset any data that was created/modified during learning so that learning can be begin anew.
      void startEpisode(State s)
      This method is called whenever a new learning episode begins
      void update(EnvironmentOutcome eo, double critique)
      Causes this object to update its behavior is response to a critique of its behavior.
